conclusion: Determine which container (D or E) the liquid will flow into after passing through the baffles.
The liquid flows out from points A, B, and C.
The direction of the flow is generally downward due to gravity.
The baffles are positioned to direct the flow.
The purple and white baffles are angled to direct flow towards the left side.
The yellow baffle is angled to direct flow towards the right side.
The liquid from A flows downward and is directed by the purple baffle towards the left.
The liquid from B flows downward and is directed by the white baffle towards the left.
The liquid from C flows downward and is directed by the yellow baffle towards the right.
The flow from A and B is directed towards the left, leading to container D.
The flow from C is directed towards the right, leading to container E.
Liquid from A and B will flow into container D.
Liquid from C will flow into container E.
